title: WPA posters
content:
I thought this might be of interest to some, even though it’s not necessarily Type-centric (though there are definitely some interesting posters in the collection with hand-made typefaces).

I recently came across the WPA poster library at the libary of congress:

[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/21111931/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010065418/http:/www.msnbc.msn.com/id/21111931/ "http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/21111931/")

This is the poster that caught my eye:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010065418im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wpa1_teeth_4256.jpg)

Anyways, I put a bit of a write up here:

[http://brokesnob.wordpress.com/2007/09/21/diy-wpa-art-prints/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010065418/http:/brokesnob.wordpress.com/2007/09/21/diy-wpa-art-prints/ "http://brokesnob.wordpress.com/2007/09/21/diy-wpa-art-prints/")

and included a PDF of a version of said poster that I re-traced as vector art for those that’d like it for your bathroom too. ;o)

 [‹ 'Difference'](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010065418/http:/typophile.com/node/37656 "Go to previous forum topic") [VEB Typoart ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010065418/http:/typophile.com/node/37854 "Go to next forum topic")
author: aluminum

comments.content: very cool, did you see the new economist posters, I think there very cool. Shall I scan some in?
If you search for “WPA” you will find all of them I think.

I just noticed my link above goes to a story about Bush vetoing kids health care.

Not quite the link I intended. OOPS!

Sorry, here’s the actual link to the WPA poster archive:

[http://lcweb2.loc.gov/pp/wpaposquery.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010065418/http:/lcweb2.loc.gov/pp/wpaposquery.html "http://lcweb2.loc.gov/pp/wpaposquery.html")

[http://www.anthonyburrill.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010065418/http:/www.anthonyburrill.com/ "http://www.anthonyburrill.com/")

Some contemporary posters of a similar ilk perhaps. Particularly ’nature’ and ’anti corruption’.
